It is an honour* sir* to meet a survivor of the armies of the

No such thing*
I beg your pardon?
No such thing*, It wasn’t a Revolution* That’s what the
British called it* We called it by its right name® War of
Independence*
I stand corrsetedj and only the other day I corrected my friend*
Mr* Beaumont for the same error*
Did you see General Washington?
I surely dido I was a drussaer boy in the retreat across New
Jersey® That was a cold campaign* that w&sj December* We
all thought the game was about up then® Later on we heard
the General about thought so tooj was writing dismal letters
to his friends about it® You Heard of Tom Paine?
Tom Paine? The infidel?
I don’t know whether he was an infidel! never got to ask him®
I know he was all for an independent America; and I know General
Washington thought a lot of him? course, he was a friend of
his® Right in the middle of that New Jersey campaign*
when iasa were all cold and sick and miserable* the General
